content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a two row table, with five columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is a. f of x is 5. Column 2. x is a, squared. f of x is 4. Column 3. x is a, cubed. f of x is 2. Column 4. x is 10 a. f of x is 1. Column 5. x is 12 a. f of x is negative 1." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mi>a</mi></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi>a</mi></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mtd><mtd><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The continuous function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is decreasing for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Selected values of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above, where <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a constant with <math alttext="1 less than a, less than 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo><</mo><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the right Riemann sum approximation for <math alttext="the integral from, a, to 12 a, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> using the four subintervals indicated by the data in the table. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="R equals, open parenthesis, a, squared, minus a, close parenthesis, times 5, plus, open parenthesis, a, cubed, minus a, squared, close parenthesis, times 4, plus, open parenthesis, 10 a, minus a, cubed, close parenthesis, times 2, plus, open parenthesis, 12 a, minus, 10 a, close parenthesis, times 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and is an underestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, a, to 12 a, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="R equals, open parenthesis, a, squared, minus a, close parenthesis, times 5, plus, open parenthesis, a, cubed, minus a, squared, close parenthesis, times 4, plus, open parenthesis, 10 a, minus a, cubed, close parenthesis, times 2, plus, open parenthesis, 12 a, minus, 10 a, close parenthesis, times 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and is an overestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, a, to 12 a, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="R equals, open parenthesis, a, squared, minus a, close parenthesis, times 4, plus, open parenthesis, a, cubed, minus a, squared, close parenthesis, times 2, plus, open parenthesis, 10 a, minus a, cubed, close parenthesis, times 1, plus, open parenthesis, 12 a, minus, 10 a, close parenthesis, times negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and is an underestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, a, to 12 a, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="R equals, open parenthesis, a, squared, minus a, close parenthesis, times 4, plus, open parenthesis, a, cubed, minus a, squared, close parenthesis, times 2, plus, open parenthesis, 10 a, minus a, cubed, close parenthesis, times 1, plus, open parenthesis, 12 a, minus, 10 a, close parenthesis, times negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and is an overestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, a, to 12 a, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="R equals, open parenthesis, a, squared, minus a, close parenthesis, times 4, plus, open parenthesis, a, cubed, minus a, squared, close parenthesis, times 2, plus, open parenthesis, 10 a, minus a, cubed, close parenthesis, times 1, plus, open parenthesis, 12 a, minus, 10 a, close parenthesis, times negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and is an underestimate for <math alttext="the integral from, a, to 12 a, of, f of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
